page.title: 04MORE ABOUT WARBOYS CLOCK
page.content: Mr. Taylor the man that looks after the {Clock Tower }has to wind it up every 8 days but he winds it up every Sunday morning. Mr. Taylor winds it up with an old car handle called a crank. The crank is stiff because of the weather conditions inside, but it hasn't rusted. The conditions of the works inside were very clean , there was a bit of oil inside so it could work properly . The {Clock Tower}was for the Jubilee of {Queen Victoria}. It has arches underneath it. It is brick built. It is situated at a fork in the road which is in the middle of where the High Street meets Ramsey Road and Church Road.It is a landmark of Warboys.There are two street lights attached to the {Clock Tower.}Some people say they spoil the clock's appearance.
